title: Discussing News and Media
description: Practice discussing news sources, media reliability, and current events.

sentences.text: By the time I heard about the story, it had already gone viral on social media.
sentences.translation: 내가 그 이야기를 들었을 때, 이미 소셜 미디어에서 바이럴이 된 뒤였다.
sentences.tips: Past perfect (had gone)로 먼저 일어난 일을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: I had never questioned news sources until I realized how much misinformation exists online.
sentences.translation: 온라인에 얼마나 많은 오보가 있는지 깨닫기 전까지 뉴스 출처를 의심해 본 적이 없었다.
sentences.tips: 'had never + 과거분사'로 과거까지의 경험 부재를 표현하세요.

sentences.text: The journalist discovered that the company had been hiding evidence for years.
sentences.translation: 그 기자는 회사가 수년간 증거를 숨겨왔다는 것을 발견했다.
sentences.tips: Past perfect continuous (had been hiding)로 과거부터 지속된 행동을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: Before social media existed, people had relied mainly on newspapers for information.
sentences.translation: 소셜 미디어가 존재하기 전에, 사람들은 주로 정보를 위해 신문에 의존했었다.
sentences.tips: 'Before ... existed, ... had relied'로 시간 순서를 명확히 하세요.

sentences.text: The story had been circulating online for hours before any major outlet reported it.
sentences.translation: 주요 언론사가 보도하기 전에 그 이야기는 온라인에서 몇 시간 동안 퍼지고 있었다.
sentences.tips: Past perfect continuous로 보도 전까지의 상황을 표현하세요.

sentences.text: I always verify information before I share it because I've seen how easily false news spreads.
sentences.translation: 가짜 뉴스가 얼마나 쉽게 퍼지는지 봤기 때문에 공유하기 전에 항상 정보를 확인한다.
sentences.tips: 현재 습관(verify, share)과 경험(have seen)을 연결하세요.

sentences.text: The newspaper apologized after it was revealed they had published inaccurate information.
sentences.translation: 그 신문사는 부정확한 정보를 게재했다는 것이 밝혀진 후 사과했다.
sentences.tips: Passive (was revealed) + past perfect (had published) 조합을 사용하세요.

sentences.text: By the time the fact-checkers investigated, thousands of people had already believed the false story.
sentences.translation: 팩트체커들이 조사했을 때, 이미 수천 명이 거짓 이야기를 믿은 뒤였다.
sentences.tips: 'By the time + past simple, past perfect'로 시간 순서를 표현하세요.

sentences.text: She explained that the sources she had consulted were all unreliable.
sentences.translation: 그녀는 자신이 참조한 출처들이 모두 신뢰할 수 없었다고 설명했다.
sentences.tips: 간접 화법에서 past perfect (had consulted)를 사용하세요.

sentences.text: The politician denied the allegations, claiming the media had taken his words out of context.
sentences.translation: 그 정치인은 미디어가 자신의 말을 문맥에서 벗어나게 인용했다고 주장하며 혐의를 부인했다.

sentences.text: I had been following the news story for weeks when the truth finally emerged.
sentences.translation: 진실이 마침내 밝혀졌을 때 나는 몇 주 동안 그 뉴스를 팔로우하고 있었다.
sentences.tips: Past perfect continuous로 진행 중이던 행동을 강조하세요.

sentences.text: The editor realized that they should have verified the story before publishing it.
sentences.translation: 편집장은 게재하기 전에 그 기사를 확인했어야 했다는 것을 깨달았다.

lines.text: Have you been following the news about the economic crisis?
Yes, but I've been careful about which sources I trust. I had heard some conflicting reports initially.
That's smart. By the time I checked multiple sources, I realized the first article I'd read had been quite biased.
It's frustrating, isn't it? Before social media, we hadn't needed to be so skeptical about every news story.
True. What sources do you usually rely on now?
I've started using a few reputable outlets that have consistently reported accurately. I also check what journalists I trust are saying.
That's a good approach. I had been just scrolling through social media for news, but I've realized that's not reliable.
Exactly. I think media literacy has become an essential skill. Schools should have started teaching this years ago.
I agree. At least some countries have begun implementing media literacy programs now.
It's better late than never. The important thing is that we stay informed while remaining critical of what we read.
